title: How to Add Swatches in InDesign

steps.title: Open the Swatches panel, which is located in the far right side of your workspace.
steps.content: Open the Swatches panel, which is located in the far right side of your workspace. If this panel is not already in your workspace, open it by selecting Windows>Colors>Swatches.

steps.title: Select Other Library from the Color Mode list.
steps.content: Select Other Library from the Color Mode list. Navigate to the file from which you would like to add swatches. Click Open and then select the swatches you would like to add.

steps.title: Open the Swatches panel and select Load Swatches.
steps.content: Open the Swatches panel and select Load Swatches.

steps.title: Navigate to the InDesign document from which you would like to add swatches and double click the file name.
steps.content: Navigate to the InDesign document from which you would like to add swatches and double click the file name.

steps.title: Open your Swatches panel and select New Color Swatch.
steps.content: Open your Swatches panel and select New Color Swatch.

steps.title: Locate the Color Mode list and select the library file from which you would like to add a swatch or swatches.
steps.content: Locate the Color Mode list and select the library file from which you would like to add a swatch or swatches. You may also select Other Library from the Color Mode list and navigate to the library file from which you would like to add a swatch or swatches.

steps.title: Select the swatches you would like to add and click Add.
steps.content: Select the swatches you would like to add and click Add.

steps.title: Open your Swatches panel and select New Color Swatch.
steps.content: Open your Swatches panel and select New Color Swatch.

steps.title: Select either Process or Spot as your color type.
steps.content: Select either Process or Spot as your color type.

steps.title: Select a mode for defining the color.
steps.content: Select a mode for defining the color.

steps.title: Drag the color sliders to adjust the color values or enter specific numeric values in the boxes located by the color sliders.
steps.content: Drag the color sliders to adjust the color values or enter specific numeric values in the boxes located by the color sliders. If you are using a spot color, select your color from the Color Mode menu.

steps.title: Click Add to add your swatch and create a new one or click OK to add your swatch and exit the window.
steps.content: Click Add to add your swatch and create a new one or click OK to add your swatch and exit the window.

steps.title: Begin creating your document and adding color as desired.
steps.content: Begin creating your document and adding color as desired. To add color to text, highlight your text using your Selection tool. Open your Swatches panel and click the Type icon. Select your desired color from the Swatches panel. To add color to a frame or other object, select the frame or object using your Selection tool. Open your Swatches panel and click either the stroke or fill icon. Select your desired color from the Swatches panel.
